steps.action: If testing was specified in a GitLab issue and download folder, add a comment to the GitLab issue indicating which packages are available, which one(s) to be tested. You can abbreviate using "linux", "macOS", and "windows".
steps.title: Record package info

steps.action: On the test machine, move any previous modelbuilder downloads/installs to the trash folder.
steps.title: Delete previous modelbuilder packages

steps.action: Create a test directory using a naming convention such as <tt>.../cmb/testing/yyyy-mm-dd</tt>.
steps.title: Create root test folder

steps.action: Download the modelbuilder package(s) to test and unzip into the test directory. Note that it might take several minutes to unzip the Windows package.
steps.title: Download modelbuilder package

steps.action:
• On linux, the directory is typically ~/.config/modelbuilder/
  • On macOS, the directory is typically ~/.config/modelbuilder
  • On Windows, the directory is typically ~/AppData/Roaming/modelbuilder
steps.title: Delete any previous modelbuilder settings files

steps.action:
• Start the modelbuilder executable
  • Click on the toolbar button "Apply changes to parameters automatically". The icon is in the first (top) toolbar and looks like a 3D box with an arrow pointing to the upper right.
  • Close all panels except for "Attribute Editor", "Output Messages", "Resources". Undock and drag the "Attribute Editor" over the "Resources" panel so that they dock as tabs.
  • In the View => Toolbars menu item, uncheck the "Measurement Tools" item to hide the "Ruler" icon.
  • Adjust the left sidebar width to approximately 1/3 of the horizontal space.
steps.title: Configure modelbuilder executable

steps.action:
• Select the Tools => Manage Plugins menu to open the Plugin Manager dialog.
  • Select the "smtkProjectManagerPlugin" in the list of Local Plugins. It should be one of only a few with its "Property" set to "Not Loaded".
  • Click "Load Selected".
  • Open the smtkProjectManagerPlugin options and check the "Auto Load" checkbox.
  • Close the Plugin Manager dialog.
steps.expect: modelbuilder menu to now include a "Project" menu.
steps.title: Load the project manager plugin

steps.expect: Verify that the widget layout is the same and that the "Project" menu is still displayed.
steps.title: Restart modelbuilder
